required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urethrocutaneous Fistula Rate After Double Dartos and Single Dartos Tubularized Incised Plate Urethroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: To Compare the Frequency of Urethrocutaneous Fistula After Double Dartos Tubularized Incised Plate (TIP) Urethroplasty and Single Dartos Tubularized Incised

brief_summary.textblock: The subjects were divided into two groups. Each group comprised 30 children. Children were randomly allocated in two groups via computer generated tables. Children in group-A underwent single dartos tubularized incised plate urethroplasty while those in group-B underwent double dartos tubularized incised plate urethroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: In group A dartos flap is raised from foreskin of the patient and applied as a single layer after tubularization in between neourethra and skin . In group B dartos flap is raised from the foreskin of patient and divided in two equal halves.Both flaps are placed as two layers in between skin and neourethra.After surgery patient is kept in ward for 10 days with stent.Patient is followed up in OPD on after 7th day after discharge for outcome.

primary_outcome.description: Abnormal communication between urethra and penile skin after urethroplasty, presenting with complaints of two streams of micturition and noted on examination at 17th postoperative day.

arm_group.description: Single dartos tubularized incised plate urethroplasty
Double dartos tubularized incised plate urethroplasty

intervention.description: To release the pediatric hypospadias using Double Dartos Tubularized incised plate (TIP) Urethroplasty
To release the pediatric hypospadias using Single Dartos Tubularized incised plate (TIP) Urethroplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria All the patients above one year of age All patients having distal and mid penile hypospadias. -
Exclusion Criteria Severe chordee Previously operated cases Patient with undescended testis Circumcised patient
-
